answers.answer: What kind of tests have they ran so far? Have they checked you for anything like mono or other infections like that?

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Recurrent or chronic fever is seen in typhoid, tuberculosis, hepatitis, SLE, rheumatoid arthritis, Polyarteritis nodosa (PAN) and other auto immune disorders, UTI, drug fever, sinusitis, glandular fever, otitis media, IBS, HIV, STDs, endocarditis, parasitic infestations (like malaria), fungal infections, lymphomas and other cancers etc. It can even be diabetes and hyperthyroidism.In women, even polycystic ovary, menopause, PID (pelvic inflammatory disease) should be investigated for.Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!
